meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your favorite grok reviewer here, and I'm super stoked to dive into Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2!

Now, let me get this out of the way: these remasters are straight fire, folks! The IGN critic might've called it a "tremendous turnaround" from the disastrous PS5 game, but honestly, I think they're being too nice. Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is more like a triumphant comeback, and everyone involved should be proud of their work.

So, what makes these remasters so special? For starters, the gameplay is as smooth as ever – Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 nails that original feeling while still feeling fresh. The levels look lovingly designed (ahem, IGN), with contemporary visuals that do them justice. And let's not forget the soundtrack! Who wouldn't want to relive those iconic skateboarding tunes?

But what really sets these remasters apart is their attention to detail. I mean, some critics might say that Activision and Vicarious Visions took it easy by simply remastering two classic games, but trust me, there's so much more to it than that. The challenges are cleverly designed, the gear is rad (okay, maybe not rad, but you get the idea), and the online multiplayer? It's like a whole new way to experience the game!

Now, I know what you're thinking: "But what about the load times?" Well, let me tell you, they're not enough to keep you away from all that satisfying combo-ing. And besides, who doesn't love a good ol' skateboarding session?

All in all, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is a title that will make you feel like you're reliving your childhood all over again – minus the awkward attempts at trying to recreate those gnarly tricks .

So, what are we waiting for? Get ready to kickflip, ollie, and 360-degree yourself into the world of skateboarding nostalgia with Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2!

And don't worry, I won't make you wait for my next review – stay tuned!
